metadata.title: CVE-2021-47207 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA:gus: fix null pointer dereference on pointer block The pointer block returnfrom snd_gf1_dma_next_block could be null, so there is a potential nullpointer dereference issue. Fix this by adding a null check beforedereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1076-fips - 4.15.0-1076.85
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1076-fips - 4.15.0-1076.85
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1076-fips - 4.15.0-1076.85
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1076-fips - 4.15.0-1076.85
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2060-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2060.62
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2060-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2060.62
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2042-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2042.46
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2042-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2042.46
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2025-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2025.27
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2025-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2025.27
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1076.85').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2060.62').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2042.46').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2025.27').
